reviews.review_msg: Nice prof but CANNOT teach. He just reads off his slides. He tends to get off track easily and talk about random things that are not related to the lecture. Because of that we are always behind on the lectures. Basically you have to teach everything to yourself.
He told me where to get cold water before exams. The water fountain he showed me really hits after chewing and inhaling some minty products.

CHEM122 with Dr. Canal was relatively straightforward. Very easy midterm but the final was relatively hard. It was difficult to hear him during lectures because of mic issues but he always posted lecture recordings. He goes over your midterm with you during office hours to see what questions you got wrong and explains questions thoroughly.

Dr. Canal is a very caring prof. He always offers extra help after lectures, even outside his office hours. Despite technical difficulties with his mic, he always posted the slides and recordings you could review in case you missed what he said in class. The midterm was quite straightforward, but the final was definitely harder.

1. Can't hear him in class cause he loves to stay quiet 
2. Worst final I have written yet, I dont know anyone that felt confident after that final, tested us on stuff he never taught 
3. Lectures were a waste of time as he read off the slides and just mumbled to himself

Voice is easy to zone out to. His lecture slides kinda sucked, so you def gotta pay attention in class. Idk why he made them in portrait instead of landscape. He posted lecture recording tho, which was nice. No huge complaints. Tutorials were optional. Idk how I got a B+, I guessed 60% of the final. Midterm was chill tho

Dr Canal is one of the good professors for Chem 122. 

His lectures are straightforward. However, sometimes, it can be hard to hear him (people in the backseat).

Lastly, his midterm is super easy, but his final is so brutal (I almost failed this exam). So, to get a B or more, you must put in tons of effort. 

HELLO! CAN YOU HEAR DR. CANAL!

His course was difficult for me, being a written course too. When you would make a mistake in the lab, he would never talk down or be rude. He will help find out what went wrong and would let you take another person's lab data if something went horribly wrong. The TAs he had were the best TAs I've ever had.

John goes straight to the point with his lectures. He took the time to go over our midterm exams with us individually. The only thing I did not like about him was how easy it was to fall asleep in his lectures. The final was just brutal, make sure you do well on everything else.

I did amazing on the midterm but idk what he pulled on the final. Final was soo tough so make sure to do very well on midterm. John as a prof is good and helpful and nice but the class itself was a bit of work. his videos and everything are clear and quizzes were easy just the final was tough

Good guy, really helpful and responsive, especially considering how large this class is. First year science courses are going to be hard regardless of the prof but he was good and exams were fair. Nice clear lectures, and recordings posted online so we didn't have to attend lectures if we felt uncomfortable. I would take another class with him

He has ZERO respect to his students, mid was delayed for half an hour and 120 people were waiting in a crowded space during COVID, and then he scheduled a drop in office hour during his lab session to view the exam result, then he lets everyone wait outside indefinitely for an hour without any explanation, not one single person got to see him.
Laziest prof ever. Lectures are super straightforward and he just gets to the point without any bs.
John is a painfully average prof. His midterm was easy and final was hard. His weekly quizzes were only marked out of 5, so they were super easy to lose marks on and some of the questions were weird.

I don't really like Chemistry but he's the best prof I've had at SFU so far. His lectures are straightforward and don't go on for hours. He tests you on what he teaches you on and he's always reachable by email. I wish he taught the lab portion as well.

Dr. Canal is an amazing prof! He always responds to emails and is very kind when you ask questions during office hours. His exams are completely fair. The only thing I did not like was the quizzes being worth 15% when each quiz was only out of 5 marks. But I highly recommend taking a class with him!
Super duper nice guy, and will go the extra mile to ensure you understand. The grading criteria isn't always clear and he can be a bit disorganized at times, but really enjoying his class.
Could do more. Problem sets littered in errors, doesn't try to correct it which becomes terribly confusing when studying. Reads the slides. Very nice to talk to but curves the course grades down.

He just made everything complicated, the whole lab is only worth for 20%, and to get that we need to tons of useless stuffs, for example you need to write a lab report, and if you not follow the rules he made, for example name it properly, and you need to upload twice, once at canvas, another at some sort of website, if you miss anything, you get 0

Very nice guy and lectures were decently engaging but his lecture notes didn't go over the topics in nearly enough length or detail (and desperately needed to be proofread). Exams were hard but mostly because he marked harshly - you only got full marks if you wrote down absolutely everything related to the (vaguely worded) questions.

Good lectures with many examples, but he is very quiet. His midterm was super easy and then the final was dreadful. He seems really kind and caring in a super nerdy way and is good at explaining course concepts clearly.

Lectures are informative and straight forward. You will do good if you pay attention in class and ask questions. He always stays after class to answer questions from students. Found him to be more useful than the tas in the course. The midterm was relatively easy but the final was a bit difficult.

His lectures are nice if you want to fall asleep. The only thing I can hear in his lectures are "can you hear me now?" The rest are mumbles. His lectures are like a poorly recorded audiobook. If you can read the ppts yourself then I suggest you do. The Midterm was the easiest thing, the final on the other hand is substantially harder.
Easy midterm and hard final of concepts you dont go over in class

The mic volume is pretty low most of the times, so it can be hard to hear him. Otherwise, his lectures are okay and he relates it to real life or tells stories sometimes which is nice. His notes are fine too. Midterm (30%) was okay, but the final (50%) was harder. Lon capa 20% so do your homework lol

Need to memorize every single ppt lecture slides including diagrams because he want you to answer very specifically. For the final exam, you will need to study about 30 or more of group presentation ppt slides on top of lecture materials. Our class average for both midterm and final were really low (50 something). Be aware of plagiarism

Rediculously difficult class considering its an elective for non science students. Lecture slides are posted online and tutorials are 15 mins long which makes it pointless to go to either. Midterms test everything even the most useless info. Half the class was accused of academic dishonesty on a  group power point project..  ( YEAH, he's THAT guy)

Needed an upper division B-sci so I took this course. I was really surprised to find that I got an A+ in this class because I did pretty bad on the midterm. The only way to succeed in this class is to memorize everything to the minutest detail, which is essentially what I did. The kind of stuff that you think will not be tested WILL show up.

What an  awful instructor. He mumbles a lot and his voice is very low. Expect you to know pretty much everything on the slides for the final.  It supposed to be science for non-science student, but you have to be good at science to succeed in this class. Also tutorials... useless! Worse class I had.

really nice guy but unfortunately very hard to understand lecture slides as they're insanely cluttered and hard to follow. definitely not an easy A as he will warn (class avg on midterm was 58). cheat sheet before tests is necessary and have to know all of it just to pass.

Honestly, this is one of the worst prof I have had at SFU. He read off slides every class which drives people away from lecture. For both of his MTs, he gives out this "what to cover" list, only that his testing materials are much more in depth than his notes. You would be bringing a pencil to a gun fight if you think that's what he tests you on.

This guy pulled the short straw when the Sci faculty picked a prof for this class. 250 non-science people just there for the credit, and a 3 hr nap.  It can't be much fun to teach, and this guy certainly conveys that. (His quiet mumbling hints it might be a confidence thing.) Nice enough guy. Study every tiny detail of the lectures and you'll pass.
Labs were fun, midterms were fair and he was very helpful during his office hours. As long as you are prepared for each lab his class was fairly easy to get a good grade in.

He seemed like a 'nice guy' at the first place. After a while left struggling with this class. The midterms were brutal and the grading was tough as well. Not very clear at explaining lecture material, so often got confused. Going through textbook made much more sense. Lectures themselves are boring. Enough to say. One of the worst classes ever.

The lectures are pretty boring and not worth attending. If you follow the cheatsheet he provides to study for exams and some extra googling into details, then you well do just fine. Group presentation is a piece of cake.

By far the most incomprehensible professor I've ever had the misfortune to listen to. Rambles incoherently (lectures were essentially pointless), expects an unreasonable amount of memorization, and his tests are very difficult.  Do not recommend.
a lot of memorizing, need to go to class for quizzes and near the end of the semester he will randomly present a topic benefiting those who attend class to take notes. fairly easy.

As others have said, he mumbles as if talking to himself fast under his breath. Very poor speaker through most of class. Only clear on "Can you hear me now?" Main lecture is a blur with bad ppt use and tons of errors. Nice guy and tries to help outside class, but you'd be better off reading the book! This class need not be hard, but it is.
This guy is basically the jimmy page of science. total rockstar

He mumbles a lot in class, and even sitting near the front, I couldn't make up what he was even though I was sitting at the front. Final was really hard with tons of conceptual questions. He began the semester with great notes, then it started getting really messy. Exams were multiple choice and open ended questions were only on scantron sheets.
Boring lecture and way too much workload for an elective course. Of course it's not an easy course which requires only memorize not understanding from phy,chem,geo and lots of materials.
Great Prof..However, midterm and final are extremely hard..He tested every single detail from the slide. It is impossible to memorize every thing.

Great prof in the sense that he is helpful, engaging and makes the course interesting with random  but relevant facts that he thinks of. However his exams are quite hard, the safer bet is to memorize everything which isn't really possible because he asks the most obscure questions
Good prof, but too much to memerize. He tested every single detail on the notes, how u gonna remember all of them I have no idea.
Great prof. Has a relaxed and laid back teaching style. He's also very nice and considerate to individual students. Really enjoyed this course a lot.
well organized and very helpful slides, midterm is easy...tutorial is waste of time and for final there will be alot of concepts than calculation.
Slept through alot of classes but still did okay because his notes were great. The midterm was okay, but the final was hard. Tutorials were useless, TA just went over loncapa.

very nice professor. he does mumble and tend to talk about things that are not directly related to the lecture material. however, they are useful and somewhat helpful. very nice to go to his office hours. very polite towards students and doesn't mind to spend extra minutes explaining lecture and loncapa materials after his assigned hours.

He's a nice guy, but I didn't think he was an effective teacher. Lectures went by too fast to understand some concepts and he basically pointed to a ppt slide, talked about it for a minute, and zoomed by to the next slide. Midterm was pretty fair but the final was tough so come prepared. Overall though, not a bad course.

Beware, he MUMBLES a lot, as if he's speaking to himself. Exams were fair, although quite a but more difficult than iclicker questions. Lectures are very boring, I only went for participation marks. Tutorials were useless, my TA only went thru lon-capa and that was it. Only go if you have specific questions

Strength: He did give good examples /elaborations in class which were not on lecture notes. If one was listening intently it was helpful in understanding the material (giving explanations in layman's terms).
 
 Weakness: I found that lectures went at such a fast pace that it was impossible to soak in anything he was saying and keep up. He did do ex

He seems to think he's got a sense of humour and spent a good chunk of every class trying to show it off. I stopped attending because the notes were online and he rambled off every ten minutes. Still a super easy course though, basically high school chem 12.
In order to do the lon-capa questions the lab manual did not have enough information so read the pages in the textbook. This is pretty easy course. Be aware of announced quizes.

Competely TERRIBLE CLASS (126)! DO NOT take it unless you absolutely have to. way way too much work considering its only 2 credits, almost no support in completing the prelab (which is a lot longer and difficult than for 121). Try to get a later lab section so other students can help you with is because the prof won't and the TAs too busy.

Great prof, no complains about this guy, always telling funny stories and related ones to the subject too. I liked his teaching method, extremely organized, only once he didn't post the notes online prior to the class, but still he did a great job. I recommend this guy very much you won't regret it as long as put some effort.
overall great prof
He is hot, but his lecture kinda boring.The exams are fair.

Class is interesting, and Prof makes lectures bearable. However, exams are tough. We only had 1 hour for a final. Lots of material to cover, but all of them not very in-depth, which makes studying very hard. Final was extremely difficult and short time.

A very interesting, and helpful lab prof.  Exams and quizzes were fair, straight off the manual.  I missed the final exam and he spent the time looking through all our next sem's schedules (by email) so that he could match it up and make up the time for the make-up exam. A very ncie prof.  Had good TA's too.

Really nice guy, very clear on expectations, very helpful and not demeaning. Tests are very fair and workload is reasonable. Always there for extra help and a good story.  A+++ Prof! Definitely one of the best!
He was a very good professor, made labs fun.  Exams were extremely fair and directly from the lab manual.  Overall, a terrific prof.

Easy lab class. Quizzes are from prelab. Lab sheets get hard half-way through the semester but you can ask around for help. Prof is VERY easy going. He is helpful and has a very fair final. One of the best profs i've had at SFU. Really wants students to do well. Overall, excellent prof!
Although this was a lab course, every time he did a lecture, he knew what he was talking about. Very aloof person and kept the lab light

Good prof, made the course easy.  Liked how he didn't brief the class because that meant we almost always got out of lab an hour early.  Available for help, marking was fair and he made the lab enjoyable.  Fun and easy course.
I love his class. Best prof i ever had Thanks for the help
He is an awesome prof and makes Chemistry interesting

really good prof..very helpful...hard but very fair midterms and final..everything os from the notes/problem sets...very approachable and gives extra help if needed...genuinley seems like he cares and wants students to do well

Course material is easy, but his questions on the midterms and finals are vague and hard.  It's like bio class, spill everything you know about the subject and you'll get a mark!  Not very fair marking, some questions are worth less (or more) than it should.  Final is worth 60%.

This prof does not brief the class as other lab profs , so be prepared ! He is mean because he answers your questions VERY LAST MIN !!  But the course is easy , so I dont think the prof is useful at all !!

Genuinly friendly and approachable - doesn't come off as students' enemy, unlike some lab instructors and TA's. Very willing to help, and to listen to students' concerns and questions. Questionable assignment of letter grades, thanks to the ol' bell curve. In our class, 86%= B+, 71.5%= C-. Go figure. I like receiving the mark I earn, but whatever.
Friendly guy, Didn't mention class was graded on the curve?!! Kinda important info! No instruction, learn on your own?
extremely laid back, tells you how to do report sheet questions and easy to get along with.
